title: Citizenship in the World
summary: Examine how nations relate, practice evaluating global issues, explore world organizations, and act as a thoughtful global citizen.

modules.title: Global Citizenship
modules.prompt: Describe what it means to be a citizen of the world and list two responsibilities you can act on now.

modules.title: Study Two Countries
modules.instructions: Compare your country with another using at least three sources. Track government type, economy, and cultural notes.

modules.title: International Organizations
modules.instructions: Research the UN plus one other organization. Note missions, decision-making, and how youth can engage.

modules.title: Global Issue Brief
modules.instructions: Summarize a current world event, the nations involved, and possible solutions. Include at least one primary-source link.

modules.title: Global Service
modules.instructions: Give 3+ hours to a project with international impact (e.g., relief drive, language tutoring, advocacy). Log tasks and reflection.

quiz.q: Which body of the UN focuses on international peace and security?
True/False: NGOs are part of a national government.
Name one way nations cooperate outside the UN.
quiz.a: Examples: trade agreements, regional alliances, scientific partnerships.
